intro: Brachyrhynchos cymbalariifolius var. rotundifolius, commonly known as the round-leafed brachyrhynchos, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Acanthaceae. It is characterized by its rounded, broad leaves that are typically arranged oppositely along the stems. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences, displaying a range of colors from white to purple. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
